title: Why boarding schools are helping to boost house prices
text:
Packing a child off to boarding school at the beginning of September and seeing them again at Christmas is a notion now confined to the same generation for whom fagging was part of the lexicon.

“The whole parental attitude is ­different,” says Douglas Robb, headmaster at Gresham’s School in north Norfolk, which has a mixture of full, weekly and flexi boarders, as well as day pupils.

“What is very clear is that the market for full-on, hardcore boarding is diminishing. We find there are ­often two professional parents working really hard during the week and so flexi or weekly boarding suits them pretty well.
